data.text:
George Palmer (George Palmer) Putnam

Born 7 Sep 1887 in Rye, Westchester, New York, United States

Ancestors

[sibling(s) unknown]

Husband of Amelia Mary Earhart — married 7 Feb 1931 (to 1937) in Noank, New London, Connecticut, USA

Father of David Binney Putnam

Died 4 Jan 1950 at age 62 in Trona, San Bernardino, California, United States

Profile last modified 29 Nov 2023 | Created 14 Nov 2008

This page has been accessed 5,856 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Name

1.2 Birth

1.3 Death

1.4 Marriage

2 Sources

Biography

George Palmer Putnam was the son of [[Putnam-631|John Bishop Putnam] and his wife, Emma Frances (Faulkner) Putnam. George was the grandson and namesake of George Palmer Putnam, founder and CEO of Putnam & Sons, publishers.

George Palmer Putnam was American aviatrix Amelia Earhart's husband and business partner in the 1930s.

George Palmer Putnam had been married before he married Amelia Mary Earhart in 1931. He had two sons by his 1st marriage to Dorothy Binney (m. 1911; divorced: 1929).[1] Dorothy is the mother of his children.

Name

George Palmer Putnam [2]

Birth

07 September 1887 in Rye, Westchester County, New York, USA.[2]

Death

04 Janusay 1950 in Trona, San Bernardino County, California, USA.[2]

Marriage

m1. 1911 Dorothy Binney

m2. Noank, New London, Connecticut, 07 Feb. 1931 Amelia Mary Earhart[2][3]

m3. Boulder City, Clark, Nevada, 21 May 1939 Jean-Marie (Cosigny) James

m4. Pasadena, Los Angeles, California, 10 June 1945 Margaret Havilland

Sources
